result.execSummary:
The defendant Caprindess M Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharge within 1 year. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- No use of illegal Drugs.

COURT OBJECTS TO EXPUNGEMENT OF THIS CASE

- Pay existing retail theft tickets.
- Complete semester at MATC.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent L.Watson appears.
Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Case set for probation review hearing. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered the condition time wiped away and no need for any further probation review hearings.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court.  Intern Katie Ginsberg appeared under the student practice rules under the supervision of Taylor Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation agent Leotis Watson appeared  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is in the hospital.    Court ordered case adjourned for probation review hearing in Branch 47.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Sentencing hearing held: 
Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant.

Court WITHHELD the sentence  and placed Defendant on Probation (with credit of 32 days time served)  with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year with the following conditions as to probation are as follows: 

Condition time: 60 DAYS in the house of correction:  STAYED until probation review hearing. 
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharge within 1 Year, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Pay existing retail theft tickets 
No use of Illegal Drugs
No new tickets for retail theft
Complete semester at MATC.

Court Objects to Expungment of this case. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.

Probation Review hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Plea Hearing held: 
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 


Plea Questionaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, received and filed.
Elements of the Offense, received and filed.
Justice Point report  dated 4-19-2016, received and filed.

Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant appears as new counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of Defense jury trial converted to plea date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney's motion to withdraw as counsel heard and granted.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel and final pre-trial conference in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Parties believe there may be a resolution.

Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
For reasons stated on the record, case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Program pretrial report dated September 30, 2015 received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed telephone contact.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Caprindess M Jones not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. Defendant has VOP hold. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Caprindess M Jones not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Boston Store

Defendant Caprindess M Jones in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Caprindess M Jones in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  State moves to amend complaint to remove "take and carry away" and amending to "transfer" in the charging portion of the Criminal Complaint.  No objection by the Defense.  Court grants motion.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
